content.description: Climb easy terrain past horizontals to a ledge.  Move left to a smaller foot-ledge, then up hidden but good hands, and finish up the top of the prow-like feature.  Belay or top-rope off the tree.  Running a cord/rope with a loop for protection on the last move makes this G-rated.
content.protection: cams, tri-cams, rope-slung pro, top-rope, or just boulder it.
content.location: Located immediately adjacent to the static rope with loops that accesses the cliff top, before reaching the K 1-5 climbs, on the Pre-K Wall.  Look for a light-colored patch of cleared rock.

content.description:
the grade is all dependent on hieght and being 5'8'' it runs about v5/v6 while for taller people in may be easier and dip down into V4. 

  start on a nice jug down low and make a move to the horizontal crack  where it starts to become slightly overhanging and work you feet up. then Dyno for the sloping lip. best place to land is on the sloping horn. then if you can hold on/ stick the dyno top out on eiser grounds.
content.protection: FA was on free with two pads and two spotters. but prior projecting used a cam in the horizontal.
content.location: on a clean short 20 foot face about 300 feet left of the over hang wall and about 20 right of the highball boulder.

content.description: Just climb the two crack you will see...
content.location: It is about 50 feet left of flakes

content.description: Just a fun little easy route
content.location: It is about 200 Ft up hill and slightly left of the cave boulder.Look for the sawed off tree in the middle of the route

content.description: Start at the crack on the left side and traverse the rail right past 3 bolts until the rail ends. Make a hard big move up to a hidden crimp to a large horizontal. Move up right past 2 bolts and a pin to the top.
content.location: Overhanging Wall

content.description: Start direct under the first bolt of the traverse. Make a hard move to gain the rail. Traverse right past 2 bolts and make a hard move up when the rail ends to a horizontal. Continue straight up past an eyebolt to a chain anchor.
content.location: Overhanging Wall

content.description: Star at the right tree then climb to the crack and traverse left to a tree then back right
content.location: Walk up the trail till it takes a hard left then it right in front of you

content.description: To the right of Two Cracks V0 is a good vertical rail on the face that leads up to the right of the cracks. Sit start on the rail and stand up into the cracks.
content.location: Just right of Two Cracks V0, sit start the obvious rail.

content.description: on the approach trail there is a large boulder. Climb the center of the boulder to a large pocket and top out. Sit starts make it harder.
content.location: trail boulder

content.description: Sit start ,Pull on little crimp and then mantle to the top
content.location: 10 feet in front of Flakes

content.description: Start low on a sloping shelf with a good left foot. Pull on and figure out how to move to the right and top out.
content.location: To the right of the big overhanging boulder at the left end of the cliff. This starts right next to Squeeze Box on the left.

content.description: Climb the big obvious dyke up the wall and pick 1 of the 3 finishes. All vary a bit from 5.7 and protect different as well. Use your head and pick one.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: At the base of the highball look right. A smaller boulder with an overhang is the climb. Start on crimps under the overhang. slap up left to the sloping lip. work right and move to a shelf. top out.
content.location: boulders

content.description: Start sitting on slopers and pull into the slot. Make your way over the roof to a exposed mantle. Make sure you clean the top off first or you will understand the route name more!
content.location: On the left end of the cliff next to the large overhanging boulder.

content.description: Stick Clip the eye bolt on the right side of the wall. Make hard moves out of the alcove. Clip the third bolt on the traverse and continue up the left finish to the chain anchor.
content.location: Overhanging Wall

content.description: A discontinous crack up the ramp in the corner. crack gets bigger at the top.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: This one is a little height dependant and hard to grade. Start sitting on the rock platform and pull on with the undercling and launch for the lip! Funner than it seems. Don't fall off the rock!
content.location: Behind the Just Visiting boulder about 30 yards the you will see a boulder with a large undercling and a rock below it.

content.description: The trail comes to the base of this climb. Climb the dyke past an bolt. Finish to trees.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: Start sitting on a sloper with left hand and a 2 finger shallow dish with the right. Figure out a way to pull off the ground and reach the crimp over the lip.
content.location: To the left of just visiting there is a seemingly blank nose, start below it.

content.description: Its all just one motion
content.location: Walk 100 Ft from parking lot turn left then 50 Ft

content.description: Stand start with hands on a flake then traverse right over a smaller boulder.Steming on the smaller boulder makes it easier.
content.location: On the boulder right next to Diagonal

content.description: Climb up the mossy face in the amphitheatre area. Climb the big jugs and horizontals to the top.
content.location: Amphitheatre Area

content.description: The middle route of the three left leaning cracks. Follow the line to the top.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: Start at the crack and move right along the rail to the first bolt. Climb straight up the face to another bolt with a optional gear placement in the hirizontal. Continue to tree above.
content.location: Overhanging Wall

content.description: Climb the only crack on the face. Top out up a gully next to a big block.
content.location: Amphitheatre Area

content.description:
K1-slab to crack-5.3 K2-blocks to a corner-5.4 K3-slabby blocks-5.4 K4-lie-back,cracks and edge to top-5.8 K5-horizontals to a crack behind oak tree-5.8

 [Note: R Hall added the photos of K1 - K 5  and their captions on 7/28/19 at the e-mail request of J. Nupp. ]
content.location: From Rines Hill Rd park near an area of the Knight's Pond gate( don't block the road), walk about 300' to remnants of a wooden gate on the left, follow cairns/tape for 15 minutes to the main wall of the cliff- a prominent dike system is straight ahead. Follow the cliff right past a white ascent/descent rope for about 30'. This is called the Pre-K wall -the next 5 climbs are a mix of horizontals, cracks,slabs and blocks. All short, but sweet with good positioning. A great introduction and/ or honing skills. We encourage any and all brushing, both here and on the main wall ,where several more routes are being developed. The approach trail has been Ok'ed by the landowner, so access is NOT an issue!

content.description: Start sitting for Just Visiting with a left hand side pull and right hand in a sloping crimp slot.
content.location: Left end of the cliff in the talas field

content.description: Start squatting in two sloper/crimp pods with less that desirable feet. Cross right hand through to a big hold, then rearrange your feet and toss left hand to a hand slot above and top out on jugs.
content.location: Start just left of Bear Naked V2 in pods.

content.description: Walk left along the base of the cliff until you come to the large obvious boulder. Climb the clean face with bigger holds up the tallest part of the boulder. Walk off the fin/ramp to ground.
content.location: boulders

content.description: Follow up cleaned rock,then slightly left to a pine just below the top of the cliff. There is a tree to belay from just back from the cliff.
content.protection: Tri cams, nuts and sling the trees.
content.location: 20' right of Dike Steps

content.description: the same all the way to the top.more slab climbing then anything.
content.location: about 200 feet up hill and right in a diagonal line from the cave boulder

content.description: Use the flakes for feet,then get your feet as high as you can....then mantle
content.location: Its 400 Ft up hill passed trial side traverse

content.description: Trad up a faint dike to a ledge. Continue up the flake and face to the trees above.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: A left leaning 4" crack. A few big pieces can protect the climb. Finish at trees.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: Climb the groove to the end, tree on the left. Move slightly left, up then back slightly right,several places for protection. Top out is spicy if you don't grab the root! Can top rope this from 2 ring tree  anchor
content.protection: small cams up to #1 ,tricams and set of nuts
content.location: 5' left of Dike Steps

content.description:
Ascend the ramp & horizontals to the top of the cliff, where you'll find nice jugs for handholds.  Find your feet, and top out.

 This climb is named in honor of the one & only Electric Wrangler, who cut her teeth at Rines with the OSP. May the legend inspire generations of future new climbers & wearers of the Seattle Sombrero.

5.7 VARIATION: Rhinestone: Look for a small pocket to the right of the ramp.  Climb up, use the 2 pockets between the horizontals as feet, and join The Electric Rodeo.
content.location: On the Pre-K wall.  Follow the cliff to the right of the Amphitheater, to where the static rope with loops accesses the top of the cliff. Pre-K wall is adjacent, to the right. Look for the ramp past horizontals climbing up and to the right.

content.description:
starts just left of old route.start just left of the small roof about 3 feet off the ground reading for a nice fist sized pod. then climb the corner using pockets and horizontals placing solid gear the whole way. then climb the face straight up to the pine tree. 

  there is also a variation that is the direct start to the right up a small flaring left facing flake(5.7).
content.protection: normal rack, small nuts, cams to size 3, and maybe a small pink tri cam.
content.location: on main wall just left of the old route right where the trail intersects with the cliff.

content.description:
Climb up some easy moves to a few awkward and fun moves around the lone bolt. Once passed the single bolt climb up easy ground to the anchor.  

  The climbing is really enjoyable and a quality route. Having the anchor is convenient, a few more routes in the area could benefit from a fixed anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack and a single bolt.
content.location: Just right of the dirty Standard Route and left of The Buddha. It is the low angle route with a lone bolt at mid-height.

content.description: Start at the obvious heart shaped hold. Climb up past old bolt holes on a faint dyke to the top.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description: There is no definite crux, its like climbing steps.
content.protection: You could use about anything in this thing.
content.location: This route is located at the far right end of the cliff, look for the steps.It is to the left of the gully to get up and down from the top of the cliff.

content.description: Sit start the crux is getting off the ground.Climb the crack.
content.location: Walk from the parking lot 100 Ft then turn right go 50 feet

content.description: Start as for Cave Traverse but follow the seam system around the corner instead of continuing up Cave Direct. Perform a full value mantle to establish on the slabby left side of the boulder.
content.location: Cave boulder.

content.description: Start on the far right side of the boulder. A series of big hands and heel hooks will bring you into the Cave Direct route. The crux is getting into the Cave Direct. Rocks at the base make it hard to get a pad in there without being in the way. Make a hard throw up to the hold over the lip and finish to top.
content.location: Cave Boulder. About 60' uphill from Blood Diamond.

content.description: Sit start in the small cave area just left of a tree. Pull on the main crimp rail in the back to start. Move up on crimps and a big hold over the lip to the top.
content.location: Cave Boulder. About 60' uphill from Blood Diamond.

content.description: Just around the corner follow another left leaning crack until it ends. Step right into a small crack and finish up the crux to trees.
content.location: Main Wall

content.description:
Make crux moves off the ground past the first bolt, then climb fun moves up to a second slabby crux around the second bolt.  

  Top out and belay from a tree, this route would be nice with a bolted anchor to eliminate the rope drag.
content.location: Just left of Moss Face and right of Dirty Bird. Easily located by the bolt at about the 8 foot mark.

content.description: About 10' right of Dike Steps is a cleaned section of horizontals leading between 2 small trees about halfway up, the finish is in a blocky section with 2 bolts- fun top out!
content.location: Approach trail comes out very close to the start

content.description: Walk up the trail from the parking lot until the trail takes a sharp left at the base of the boulders. Walk right in the opposite direction of the trail for 150' to a pointed boulder. start on two small crimps with a good left foot of the arching rail. a one move wonder sticking the next crimp. top out at the point.
content.location: boulders

content.description: Near the top it a push to get to a crimp but its big
content.location: About 50 feet in front of the overhanging wall.   Dismount off the right side

content.description: Ascends easy terrain past horizontals past the ledge to a left-facing, ear-like feature. Find the top, then finish up the center of the bow-like feature.Named as it was cleaned and climbed before & after the bass spawning season in NH
content.protection: Cams, tri-cams. Top-roping, or a loop slung over the top from the tree, makes it G-rated.
content.location: Walk right at the amphitheater, then To the right of the static rope with loops that accesses the top of the cliff.  Look for the left-facing ear-like feature and climb to it.  Belay or toprope off tree at top of cliff.  Walk off using aforementioned rope.

content.description: Climb the arete to the top staying to the left side
content.protection: pads,maybe a spotter for the tree on the left
content.location: Walk uphill till the trail takes a sharp left.Turn right and go about 150 ft.Its on the same boulder as blood diamond.

content.description: Just to the left of the high ball is a cleaned off arete. Climb the arete on good holds to the top.
content.location: Boulders

pathTokens: New Durham Area  (Longstack, Devil's Den, Rines Hill, etc.)

content.description: Rines Hill is located in Alton, NH. The cliff is mostly trad and has a few overhanging sport routes. The cliff is about 40 feet at the max. This is a great area for moderate crack lines. All the routes can be toproped from trees above. Lots of boulders in the area.
